Step 2: Create Sketch Create the first sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Face 1 Create two loops on Face 1 of the sketch, as follows: Loop 1 1. Draw a line from point (0, 0) to point (0.025, 0). 2. Draw a line from point (0.025, 0) to point (0.025, 0.025). 3. Draw a line from point (0.025, 0.025) to point (0, 0.025). 4. Draw a line from point (0, 0.025) to point (0, 0) to close the loop. Loop 2 1. Draw a line from point (0.0015, 0.0015) to point (0.0235, 0.0015). 2. Draw a line from point (0.0235, 0.0015) to point (0.0235, 0.0235). 3. Draw a line from point (0.0235, 0.0235) to point (0.0015, 0.0235). 4. Draw a line from point (0.0015, 0.0235) to point (0.0015, 0.0015) to close the loop. Step 3: Scale the Sketch Scale the entire sketch by a factor of 0.025. Step 4: Extrude Sketch to Generate 3D Model Extrude the sketch by 0.75 units towards the normal direction and 0 units opposite the normal direction, resulting in a new solid body. This completes the long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, which matches the given shape description with a length of 0.025 m, width of 0.025 m, and height of 0.75 m.</description>
